title: Average marks obtained by 100 students is 45. If the average marks obtained by successful students is 35 and that by unsuccessful students is 15, then the number of successful students in that examination is? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question is incorrect. Average of any numbers will lie between the max and min value. Here max value is 35 and min value is 15. Hence average should lie between 35 and 15. Hence, no possibility of 45 as an average between 35 and 15. HTH

Assume, No. Of succesful students is n So, No. Of unsuccessful students will be (100-n) Average= Sum of marks of all students/No. Of students 45= 35n +15(100-n)/100 Solve and you get n=150 Note-You should check out definition and meaning of Average if you dont know.
Question not feasible as average marks by successful and unsuccessful students are less than average marks of total students
